content.question: In 2017, the United States exported approximately $500 million of beef to Mexico, and Mexico exported approximately $500 million of beef to the United States. Which of the following best explains this international supply chain?

choices.label: United States consumers prefer to purchase specialty products made from beef raised in Mexico.
Mexico depends on beef imports because domestic beef production is too low.
United States and Mexican producers rely on each other’s market to sell certain beef products.
The United States and Mexico have an agreement to evenly exchange beef products.
Mexico’s beef industry produces a surplus and depends on beef exports.

content.answer: United States and Mexican producers rely on each other’s market to sell certain beef products.
